ac:rich-text-body.p: Business (or logical) models, domain models - they all describe subject-specific, business aspects, without relation to technology.

Often these structures or concepts are re-used at many places within an architecture, especially within chapter
.
Often parts of these models reappear in the building block view, but in order to „keep them clean from technology“ they can be captured as a concept.
Usually either ER-Models (Entity-Relationship Models) or UML class diagrams (mainly containing entity classes) are used to document domain models.
